verses.roman:
vācā madhurayā prīṇann
idam āhānna-tarpitān
pādāv aṅka-gatau viṣṇoḥ
saṁspṛśañ chanakair mudā

synonyms: vācā—in a voice; madhurayā—gentle; prīṇan—trying to please them; idam—this; anna—with food; tarpitān—who had been gratified; pādau—the feet; aṅka—on his lap; gatau—situated; viṣṇoḥ—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; saṁspṛśan—massaging; śanakaiḥ—slowly; mudā—happily.
translation: When they had eaten to their full satisfaction, for their further pleasure the King began to speak slowly and in a gentle voice as he held Lord Viṣṇu's feet in his lap and happily massaged them.
